description.narrative: The project is expected to achieve a significant development impact at two levels: (a) Contribute to increasing access to finance to micro, small and medium enterprises: BCP''s strategy is to strengthen its positioning in the Casablanca region. By supporting BCP, IFC will enable the Bank to gain market share and consolidate its leadership in the MSME and retail segment and therefore support economic activity and job creation. (b) Contribute to increasing banking penetration: Traditionally, BCP Group has played a key role in providing banking services to low-income market and therefore in increasing banking penetration in Morocco. The proposed project will contribute to further developing access to banking services for retail clients in Morocco.

The proposed project involves an equity investment in Banque Centrale Populaire (BCP or the Bank). BCP is the central entity of Banque Centrale Populaire Group (BCP Group), the second largest banking group in Morocco. BCP is listed on the Casablanca Stock Exchange and controls several specialized non banking financial institutions offering leasing, consumer finance, investment banking in addition to commercial banks in Sub-Saharan Africa and Europe. The Group has been traditionally focused on financing SMEs, mostly in the peripheral regions where it is considered Moroccos SME Bank. It is also the market leader in terms of deposit mobilization and expatriates remittances.

mailing-address.narrative: Mr. Mouhssine Cherkaoui Administrateur Directeur Général Délégué Upline Corporate Finance (Groupe Banque Centrale Populaire) 37, Bd Abdellatif Benkaddour 20050 Casablanca, Morocco Tel : +212 522 997 171 Fax : +212 522 997 191

name.narrative: BCP is headquartered in Casablanca, Morocco. and has a 159 branch network. BCP also has several subsidiaries, including in Europe, Guinea, Central African Republic and Mauritania

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.
